title: Consortium to Buy Nielsen for $16 Billion Including Debt
sub_head: Elliott, Brookfield to pay $28 a share for TV ratings company
body:
Nielsen Holdings PLC agreed to sell itself to a group of private-equity firms in a deal that values the media-measurement company at $16 billion including debt, resurrecting a deal after talks fell apart last week.
A consortium led by Elliott Management Corp.â€™s private-equity arm and Brookfield Asset Management Inc. agreed to pay $28 a share for the company, Nielsen said Tuesday.
